Description.val: Ground Based Air Defense-Transformation (GBAD-T) supports the Low Altitude Air Defense (LAAD) Battalion's missions of Short Range Air Defense (SHORAD) and Force Protection.  The Advanced Man-Portable Air Defense System (A-MANPADS) Fire Unit is a mobile, Stinger missile-based low altitude surface-to-air weapons system designed to provide close-in short range air defense. A-MANPADS assets are organic to the Low Altitude Air-Defense (LAAD) Battalion of the Marine Air Control Group (MACG). LAAD Battalions support the Marine Air Ground Task Force by defending forward combat areas, maneuver forces, vital areas and installations, and units engaged in special or independent operations.  The LAAD Battalion consists of a headquarters and two A-MANPADS firing batteries. Each firing battery, in turn, consists of a battery headquarters and two A-MANPADS firing platoons.  Firing platoons include a platoon headquarters and three firing sections, the smallest tactical units of the LAAD Battalion.  The A-MANPADS Section is comprised of a Section Leader and five Fire Units.  The Section Leader oversees the deployment of the Fire Units and directs their fires in support of the overall air defense plan.  A major service-life extension must be conducted in order to mitigate the potential gap between the current and follow-on weapon system.  Therefore, GBAD is executing a Service Life Extension Program (SLEP), due to the approaching shelf life expiration of the Stinger Missile.  Additionally, GBAD requires an Optics upgrade/replacement of the current Stinger Missile Night Sight (AN/PAS-18)), and replacement of the Identification Friend or Foe (IFF) belt pack (AN/PPX-3B).

Justification.val:
The FY 2016 funding request was reduced by $6.445M to account for the availability of prior year execution balances.

FY2014 Baseline Appropriation:
Ground Based Air Defense-Transformation (GBAD-T) $18.656M - Performed data collection, training, support equipment and interim contractor support required to support the procurement of the end item. Began performing Service Life Extension Program (SLEP) for the Stinger missile inventory, as it is approaching shelf life expiration. This initiative replaced degraded components to extend the life of the Stinger missile. The FY14 SLEP budget of $18.656M reflected the cost for a variety of components, such as replacement warhead sections, with various procurement and installation unit costs.

FY2015 Baseline Appropriation:
Ground Based Air Defense-Transformation (GBAD-T) $30.339M - Continue Service Life Extension Program (SLEP) for the Stinger missile inventory, as it is approaching shelf life expiration. The SLEP is a Joint effort with the US Army as lead service. The majority of the USMC missiles undergoing SLEP will be inducted in FY15 after the Army inducts their missiles. This initiative will replace degraded components to extend the life of the Stinger missile. The FY15 SLEP budget of $29.271M reflects the cost for a variety of components, such as replacement warhead sections, with various procurement and installation unit costs. Procurement for A-MANPADS was removed in FY15 due to prioritization of funding to Stinger Missile SLEP, and development preparation for A-MANPADS tech refresh in conjunction with procurements in FY's 16-18 to reach AAO.  The cost increase ($11.683) in funding from FY14 to FY15 supports the majority of the USMC missiles undergoing SLEP in FY15 after the Army inducts their missiles.

FY2016 Baseline Appropriation Request:
Ground Based Air Defense-Transformation (GBAD-T) $7.565M - Continue the Service Life Extension Program (SLEP) for the Stinger missile inventory, as it is approaching shelf life expiration. The FY16 SLEP budget of $4.824M reflects the cost for a variety of components, such as replacement warhead sections, with various procurement and installation unit costs.  A-MANPADS upgrade restarts in FY16 ($2.535M) and continues through FY19 to reach AAO. Funding decreases from FY15 to FY16 due to the significant investment in the Stinger Missile SLEP in FY15.

OCO: 
FY2014 Overseas Contingency Operations Request (OCO): N/A

FY2015 Overseas Contingency Operations Request (OCO): N/A

FY2016 Overseas Contingency Operations Request (OCO): N/A

Name.@footnote: FY15 1.1 - Advanced MANPAD procurement halted in FY15 due to prioritization of PMC to Stinger Missile SLEP, and development preparation for A-MANPADS tech refresh in conjunction with procurement to AAO across FY16-18.
Unit Cost fluctuates due to economies of scale. FY14 Stinger Missile SLEP includes US Army SLEP of 855 missiles. FY16 Stinger Missile SLEP assumes Qatar FMS SLEP of 300-370 missiles.
Name.val: 1.1.2) Stinger Service Life Extension Program (SLEP) Recurring
